programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mysterious computer crash pushed a thriving manufacturing company to the brink of collapse, jeopardizing hundreds of employees' jobs. Forensic investigators must determine if the crash was the result of a computer defect, human error, or sabotage.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a fire destroyed most of a home and a young boy went missing, police organized the largest search in the history of their small town. First the boy's backpack was discovered five miles from home, and then his body was found 50 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists work with the only clue recovered from a multiple-victim shooting: a 12-gauge shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon in order to trace it to its owner.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: 1984 Rajneeshee bioterror attack: investigators uncover a plot to overthrow the government after a unique strain of salmonella makes people ill.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide _ but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body _ but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: California police had several suspects in the robbery and brutal murder of an elderly couple. Ten years later, a determined forensic scientist used material from a dentist's office to uncover ballistic evidence which had been overlooked.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A fire erupted in Kings Cross Station in London, killing 31 people and injuring dozens more. Investigators pinpointed the cause of the fire, but it took state-of-the-art technology and fluid dynamics experts to explain why it became a deadly inferno.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A go-go dancer told her family she needed to get away for a while, and then she simply disappeared. Investigators were suspicious, because she took neither her car nor her clothes. 20 years later, her family received a call that changed everything.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of Philadelphia college athlete Aimee Willard is investigated after her car was found on the roadside. When her body is found, the police find unusual marks on her body and DNA evidence that eventually lead to her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer found a woman's body while on routine patrol of a public park. The victim had been stabbed to death and, during the autopsy, the medical examiner preserved the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of 9-year-old Jessica Knott is investigated. Investigators use a garbage bag to connect suspect James Edward Crow, Jr. to the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three seemingly unrelated deaths proved to be serial murders. The killer had been careful _ he used poison which had no taste or odor. Fortunately for investigators, it also had a unique chemical signature.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The news of a flight attendant's brutal murder prompted the son of a victim who had been killed five years earlier to contact police. Both murders had similar MOs, and analysis of biological evidence proved that these were serial killings.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a brutal attack on two boys near a pond relies on evidence fished out of the murky water. It was the first case where Diatom evidence was used to place a suspect at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of the kidnapping of a prominent banker's wife led police on a wild goose chase. An unexpected discovery made by an entomologist led to a new suspect, and the realization that ordinary office equipment can leave extraordinary clues.

programme.desc: Police are dispatched to the scene of a shooting, and discover the victim's husband is one of their own: a homicide detective who says his wife accidentally shot herself in the head.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.desc: A cop searches for Nikita as a witness to a man's crimes.

programme.title: La Femme Nikita
programme.desc: Nikita is brainwashed to perform a suicide/assassination.

programme.title: La Femme Nikita
programme.desc: Nikita is torn when she hears a killer's story.

programme.title: La Femme Nikita
programme.desc: Michael tries to save Nikita on a mission.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross decides to move into Southfork. Rebecca approaches Bobby and Christopher with information that she believes might help save the ranch. MITCH PILEGGI guest stars.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Rebecca reveals a life-changing secret to Elena. Meanwhile, John Ross tries to turn one family member against another and a family associate is murdered.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Christopher moves closer to his dream when a large oil company approaches him about rights to new methane technology. And the Ewings fight to protect Southfork from outsiders.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross learns the value of family when he must choose between blood and oil. Sue Ellen and Rebecca both find themselves victims of men who could destroy their lives.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the dramatic season one finale, Christopher and Elena begin to learn that not everyone is as they appear to be. Long-buried secrets are revealed as the past rears its ugly head.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the second season premiere, as Christopher seeks to gain the upper hand in his divorce from Rebecca Sutter, a game-changing revelation turns everything on its head.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Pamela Rebecca Barnes schemes with John Ross to fulfill her father's desire for revenge. Ryland's mother (JUDITH LIGHT) proves just as evil as her son.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Pamela pushes her father's agenda to gain control of Ewing Energies. As a new member of the family arrives at Southfork, Ann is pushed to the brink by Ryland's sadistic games.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: J.R. works to undermine Pamela, forcing John Ross to choose between a Ewing and a Barnes. Cliff Barnes (KEN KERCHEVAL) returns to meet with an unlikely visitor.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross' plot to take over Ewing Energies solidifies; Christopher changes tactics with Pamela Barnes; and an enemy from the Ewings' past resurfaces.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: With Drew's help, Christopher makes a startling revelation that may change the fate of Ewing Energies. The family comes together when an outsider tries to undermine them all.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the aftermath of John Ross and Sue Ellen's coup, Bobby's brother Gary (TED SHACKELFORD) helps him retaliate. Christopher and John Ross clash in a winner-takes-all car race.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: J.R. Ewing finally meets his end. The family strives to set aside their differences and mourn together. Accompanied by many characters from J.R.'s past, the Ewings bury their own.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Bobby, Christopher and John Ross work on J.R.'s masterpiece. J.R.'s will has lasting effects on the family legacy. Sue Ellen tries to get Gary (TED SHACKELFORD) out of Dallas.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Pamela's mother, Afton Cooper (AUDREY LANDERS), returns to Dallas. Emma is put in the middle of her father and grandmother's relationship, pushing her closer to Drew.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: The Ewings' investigation of a conspiracy continuing to blame Christopher for recent events brings revelations in line with J.R.'s masterpiece. A new adversary is added to the mix.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: After Cliff (KEN KERCHEVAL) and Ryland put Ewing Energies on the verge of collapse, the Ewings battle back. Christopher gets closer to finding his mother.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross lets Pamela in on J.R.'s master plan, but his trust may be misplaced. Drew confides a dark secret to Elena, forcing her to choose between her family and Christopher.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross and Pamela make a shocking discovery about an enemy's location the night J.R. was killed, compelling Bobby to reveal more of J.R.'s master plan. LEE MAJORS guest stars.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq open a hip Hollywood nightclub to trap a major ring dealing Ecstasy. When the investigation encounters problems, Billie gets involved.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van frees his legendary convict father, Raymond, from prison to help with a counterfeiting case.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: After Deaq poses as a corrupt cop who threatens to expose assassin Sophia Jones, Billie and Van follow her. They must race to prevent Deaq from becoming Sophia's next victim.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie assigns Van and Deaq to infiltrate a drug ring along with Alexa, her best friend from the police academy. The situation quickly worsens, and Alexa's life is put in danger.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the electrifying second season finale, the Ewings unite to execute J.R.'s master plan and the shocking answer to the question "Who killed J.R.?" is finally revealed.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: The third season begins with the Ewings on top, having vanquished Cliff Barnes (KEN KERCHEVAL). But solidarity can only last for so long, and conflicts arise.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: With Nicolas' arrival, John Ross tries to keep his plans moving forward, locking horns with Bobby in the process. Emma enlists the help of her grandmother (JUDITH LIGHT).

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Bobby scrambles to outmaneuver John Ross' efforts to frack on Southfork. Christopher makes a startling discovery about Nicolas' past, as Nicolas and Elena's partnership heats up.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: It's wedding day at Southfork and the groom, John Ross, has skipped out to strike a deal with a family adversary. AUDREY LANDERS, STEVE KANALY and CHARLENE TILTON) guest star.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Christopher learns surprising details about Heather's (ANNALYNNE McCORD) past and Cliff (KEN KERCHEVAL) persuades Elena to try a new tact. STEVEN WEBER appears as the Governor.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross scrambles to keep the Arctic lease deal alive, even if he must betray those who love him most. Ryland's plot to keep Emma and John Ross apart takes an unexpected turn.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross pushes ahead on his plans for control of Ewing Global, enlisting the help of one of J.R.'s last business partners. Elena's brother, Drew (KUNO BECKER), returns to Dallas.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Pamela's discovery that John Ross has been sleeping with Emma ignites a firestorm. As cliffhangers build, lives and relationships are brought to the brink.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: The Ewing family searches for answers as to who set the fire at Southfork Ranch and who will survive. John Ross and Emma struggle with their role in Pamela's overdose.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Christopher and Heather's (ANNALYNNE McCORD) relationship is tested as John Ross tries to redeem himself with Pamela. Elena makes a drastic move to get justice for her family.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Elena finally confronts the Ewings. The family is shocked, realigning relationships and forcing Bobby to re-examine the steps he took to implement J.R.'s master plan.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: As Ewing Global goes public, everyone scrambles to claim ownership. Bobby seeks the aide of old flame (MELINDA CLARKE) to help get back control of the company.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Elena learns the truth about Nicolass connections to the cartel, which sends her spiraling and Christopher fears for her safety. Bobby must make a choice he never anticipated.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Nicolas tries to prove himself to Elena by making a deal with the authorities that puts him on a collision course with John Ross' plan and places both their lives in jeopardy.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the season finale, enemies are unmasked, new alliances are formed and John Ross learns a shocking secret about J.R. that sends him in search of a surprising new cohort.

programme.title: Evil Stranger
programme.desc: When a young woman disappears from the streets of Southampton, England, police launch a massive manhunt. But the killer is one step ahead and flees to India, with the victim's parents hot on his heels.

programme.title: Deadly Curves
programme.desc: A self-proclaimed doctor in Florida specializes in buttock enhancements. Shockingly, this medical unprofessional injects tire-sealant, bathtub caulk and liquid cement into her patients - with homicidal consequences.

programme.title: Stranger At The Station
programme.desc: When a popular young student vanishes, her boyfriend tells police the last time he saw her was at Oxford station with a mysterious stranger by her side. The police sketch bears a remarkable resemblance to someone close to her.

programme.title: Vulture Feeder Fiend
programme.desc: During their investigation into murderer Ed Kemper, detectives become painfully aware that there is another serial killer on the loose. When police eventually zero in on their suspect, they discover a follower of the occult who believes he is sacrificing people to save humanity.
